alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 10:12AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms will impact portions of central Kanawha and northeastern Lincoln Counties through 1045 AM EDT... At 1012 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms near Alum Creek, or 12 miles east of Hamlin, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor water problems could be possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Marmet, Cross Lanes, Pinch, Alum Creek, Institute, Tornado, Coal Fork, Elkview, Sod and Yawkey. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 114. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 46 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 91 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 63 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
